answer: Yes. You can make an appointment at your local public health unit (community health centre) for your children to get immunized. You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here: http://www.immunizebc.ca/finder.
answer_formatted:
## Yes.


## You can make an appointment at your local public health unit (community health centre) for your children to get immunized.

You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here:http://www.
immunizebc.
ca/finder.
question: our family dr has retired and we have not yet found a new 1, but our kids r overdue for some of their vaccinations. Is it possible to have them done at a clinic or community health nurse?
question_variation_0: what to get children's vaccinations done on a clinic
question_variation_1: what type of clinic should i see for vaccines
question_variation_2: do i need to do a child's vaccines at clinic or health nurse?
